Description: Floor sherd of black-figured North Ionian pottery plate (rim mostly lost); ridged on both sides; creamy white slip; upper surface: on what is preserved of rim, added red band probably lined in white; adjacent ridge has dots on it; to the centre, between bands, frieze of incised griffin protomes to left (two complete and parts of three others preserved; added red on necks); teo glazed ridges framing frieze of tongues at centre; underside: bands on outer flat area; five ridges to the centre, alternately glazed and reserved.
Curator's comments: Most probably from same piece as GR 1888.6-1.553.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.809)
